page.title: 04Famous People Babraham
page.content: {Jonas Webb}1796-1862. Famous tenant farmer of Church Farm renowned for improving southdown sheep prized for wool and meat. Received silver ornament of tree and grazing horses from Emperor Louis Napoleon. Bronze statue now stands in High Street, Babraham. {Bush and Benet Foundation.}In 1730 Judith Benet's will stated her wish for the provision of six almshouses and a charity school costing Â£500. Â£100 was provided for the schoolmaster, almshouse tenants and apprentices.Levinus Bush, the Lord of the manor in 1724, also contributed some money in his will. Education was to be provided free unless parents haf land with income of over Â£50 annually. The original school was held at School House built in 1732, a listed building still standing flanked by almshouses.
